pr_title: Modified safe delta mode to allow for fast merges in more cases

timeline.message: Modified safe delta mode to allow for fast merges in more cases
Refactored to check validity of last value on a per type basis
Fixed encoding of NaNs which never lead to IDENTICAL encoding.

timeline.bodyText:
I think validLastDoubleValue and validLastBDValue could also be used to tell if the last floating-point value is encoded as BigDecimal or doubleinstead of setting lastBDValue to null:

validLastDoubleValue && !validLastBDValue -> last value encoded as double
!validLastDoubleValue && validLastBDValue -> last value encoded as BigDecimal
!validLastDoubleValue && !validLastBDValue -> unknown last value floating-point value
validLastDoubleValue && validLastBDValue -> cannot happen

Thus validLastDoubleValue && null == lastBDValue could be replaced by validLastDoubleValue.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Ditto, only testing validLastBDValue should be enough to be sure lastBDValue is non-null. It can be argued that the nullity check prevents a NPE though.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: lastGeoXPPoint = GeoTimeSerie.NO_LOCATION; is unnecessary since validLastGeoXPPoint is set to false.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: lastElevation = GeoTimeSerie.NO_ELEVATION; is unnecessary since validLastElevation is set to false.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: I think setting validLastBDValue to false is clearer than setting lastBDValue to null. This change goes with the first comment.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Also sets validLastDoubleValue to false. Also goes with first comment.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Instead copy last loc/elev/values according to valid* booleans.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Added the copying of the valid* flags, but left the noDeltaMetaTimestamp forced to true by leaving the call to safeDelta as a first step
replies.author: hbs
